It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its unique, clustered inflorescences and small, pea-like flowers. The plant exhibits a woody stem with thick, leathery leaves that are adapted to the harsh, cold climate of its habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
